title: Mexican Journalist Who Told Country’s President She Feared for Her Life Is Killed
sub_head: Shooting death underscores Mexico’s reputation as one of the most dangerous places in the world for local journalists to work
body:
MEXICO CITY—A second Mexican journalist in a week was gunned down in the border city of Tijuana, underscoring Mexico’s reputation as one of the most dangerous places in the world for local journalists to work.
Lourdes Maldonado, a well-known local television personality who worked for various media outlets in Tijuana, was shot in her car by unknown assailants as she arrived home Sunday night, according to local authorities.
